title: Yvelines: in Magny-les-Hameaux, tensions after the distribution of a leaflet on a mosque project - The Limited Times
text:
He didn't think it prudent to turn back to spend the holidays at home. Pierre-Louis Brière, 25, who lives in Magny-les-Hameaux (Yvelines), a town of 10,000 inhabitants, packed his bags with his wife and children on the night of 8 to 9 December. Since then, he has been staying with relatives. At the beginning of December, he received death threats by phone, about ten of them, according to him. The words he reports are unequivocal: "We're going to massacre you one by one", "We have your address", "We meet you every day in the street and for the moment we smile at you but..." »
What's next after this ad
The avalanche originated in a leaflet linked to the mosque project carried out by the Association of Muslims of Magny (A2MH). The document comes from the Magny Citizens' Committee, an "apolitical" collective born in November 2023 and made up of some 350 people, who are mobilizing "on issues of local interest". "In this text, we were simply asking questions about the opacity surrounding this mosque project," explains Pierre-Louis Brière. It is a request for information for all citizens. »
